ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would absolutely recommend this course. It can be a little challenging for undergraduates, but the mixture of undergraduate and graduate students created a surprisingly supportive and diverse environment of critical opinion.

I would - without hesitation - recommend this course to any of my fellow students. If you are studying literature and you want to learn how to (critically) read - which is not always and necessarily an ability given for granted - you should take this class.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: More than just broadening my knowledge of the authors/texts we covered, I feel like this was a wonderful experience for honing my own close-reading abilities and provided for some well-appreciated diversity in my coursework.
